intro: Cremanthodium lingulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in high-altitude environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
